definition: (political) right/right wing/rightist
right (-hand)/the Right (politics)/west (old)
clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie
rightist elements
Anti-Rightist Movement, Mao's purge of "rightists" after the Hundred Flowers Campaign ended in 1957
bourgeois rightist faction (esp. during anti-rightist movement of 1957-58)
pinyin: zi1 chan3 jie1 ji2 you4 pai4

sentences.english: Churches are now too often destructive battlegrounds of an ideological right and left.
sentences.chinese: 而今教堂往往成为意识形态左右派相斗的消极战场。

sentences.english: He was wronged as a Rightist in 1957, thus keeping silent for over 21 years.
sentences.chinese: 1957年被错划右派，从此沉寂长达二十一年。

sentences.english: Are the left and right so religiously cleaved ?
sentences.chinese: 至于左派与右派，在宗教信仰上是否也壁垒分明？

sentences.english: Where left and right agree is that America feels adrift right now.
sentences.chinese: 左派和右派都认同的一点是美国现在处于迷茫期。

sentences.english: For both the left and right this means anti-intellectual.
sentences.chinese: 不管左派右派，这就代表反知识分子。

sentences.english: It was necessary for us to combat bourgeois Rightists, but we went too far.
sentences.chinese: 反对资产阶级右派是必要的，但是搞过分了。

sentences.english: Can the religious left become a force in American politics comparable to the right-wing version?
sentences.chinese: 宗教左派是否能成为和右派相当的美国政治力量？

sentences.english: Rightists don’t revel in the plight of workers either.
sentences.chinese: 右派也不会对工人阶层所处的窘境而欢欣。

sentences.english: It was the Rightist Chang-Lo alliance that wanted us to go backward .
sentences.chinese: 要促退我们的，是那个右派章罗同盟。

sentences.english: The right praised him as a man of principle who also overflowed with the milk of human kindness.
sentences.chinese: 右派称赞他是一位充盈着人性之善的正直之士。

sentences.english: Even so, the cap must fit, and only confirmed Rightists should BE laBElled as such.
sentences.chinese: 但是也要扣得对，确是右派才给他扣上右派这顶帽子。

sentences.english: Even so, the cap must fit, and only confirmed Rightists should BE laBElled as such.
sentences.chinese: 但是也要扣得对，确是右派才给他扣上右派这顶帽子。

sentences.english: But labelling the Rightists is a different matter.
sentences.chinese: 只有扣帽子一事，对右派当别论。

sentences.english: They are only a handful and are Rightists.
For real tempering this time we have to thank the Rightists.
sentences.chinese: 真正讲锻炼，这一回还是要感谢右派。

sentences.english: The Rightists are very good teachers by negative example.
sentences.chinese: 右派是很好的反面教员。

definition: rightist elements
capitalist roader (person in power taking the capitalist road, a political label often pinned on cadres by the Red Guards during the Cultural Revolution)
counterrevolutionary
(political) left/left wing/leftist
anti-rightist/abbr. for 反右派鬥爭|反右派斗争[Fan3 you4 pai4 Dou4 zheng1]
Anti-Rightist Movement, Mao's purge of "rightists" after the Hundred Flowers Campaign ended in 1957
persons or faction in authority
an extreme right-winger
rebel faction
stinking intellectual (contemptuous term for educated people during the Cultural Revolution)
to drag sb before a public meeting to denounce, humiliate and physically abuse them (esp. during the Cultural Revolution)
bad element/bad egg
Cultural Revolution (1966-76)/abbr. for 文化大革命[Wen2 hua4 Da4 ge2 ming4]
Gang of Four: Jiang Qing 江青, Zhang Chunqiao 張春橋, Yao Wenyuan 姚文元, Wang Hongwen 王洪文, who served as scapegoats for the excesses of the cultural revolution
political movement
to seize and subject to public criticism (form of persecution during the Cultural Revolution)
